para.emphasis: This class implements the computation of an optimization step via a Steepest-Descent-method.

literallayout.computeroutput: 1 #ifndef OptimizationSD_H_ 2 #define OptimizationSD_H_ 3 4 #include "OptimizationAlgorithm.h" 5 #include "../Core/Waveguide.h" 6 /** 7 * \class OptimizationSteepestDescent 8 * \brief This class implements the computation of an optimization step via a Steepest-Descent-method. 9 * 10 * Objects of the Type OptimizationAlgorithm are used by the class OptimizationStrategy to compute the next viable configuration based on former results. Its is encapsulated in it's own class to offer comparison and easy changing between different schemes. 11 * \author Pascal Kraft 12 * \date 29.11.2016 13 */ 14 class OptimizationSteepestDescent : public OptimizationAlgorithm<double> { 15 16 public: 17 18 19 OptimizationSteepestDescent(); 20 21 ~OptimizationSteepestDescent(); 22 23 /** 24 * The optimization is mainly split into two kinds of steps: Full and small steps. For FD based schemes, a small step is a computation of finite differences for all degrees of freedom which entails a lot of computation. Small here refers to the norm of the step width - not necessarily to the amount of computation required. 25 * In general this function is supposed to gather information about the target functional around the current state. 26 * \param small_steps_before this number tells the scheme how many small steps were performed before the current request. 27 * \return this is true, if the Optimization Scheme requires more small steps before a big step can be performed. 28 */ 29 bool perform_small_step_next( int small_steps_before ) ; 30 31 /** 32 * For the optimization scheme to know, which step size is appropriate, this function was included. 33 * \param small_steps_before similar to perform_small_step_next this is the number of small steps before the current one. 34 * \return double this is how much the values of the degrees of freedom should be adapted. 35 */ 36 double get_small_step_step_width( int small_steps_before ); 37 38 /** 39 * This functions returns true, if enough steps were performed to compute the next state to compute a full solution on. 40 * \param small_steps_before number of small steps performed before this call. 41 * \return true, if the next computation should be a big step - otherwise false. 42 */ 43 bool perform_big_step_next( int small_steps_before ) ; 44 45 /** 46 * This function computes the states that should be computed next. If the next step will be a small step the update can be done by simply updating all dofs with a step width (or only one depending on the pattern) so this function is only used when a big step will be computed next and therefore all dofs could change differently. 47 * \return This is a vector of degrees of freedom which can be used by the Optimization Strategy to update the Space Transformation. 48 * 49 */ 50 std::vector<double> get_big_step_configuration() ; 51 52 }; 53 54 #endif
